aiAdvice.description: Deploy continuous DCRM monitoring system to track contact resistance variations in real-time, enabling early detection of degradation patterns.
aiAdvice.title: Implement Real-time Contact Resistance Monitoring

aiAdvice.description: Address the detected contact bounce (55-65ms region) through operating mechanism calibration and spring tension adjustment.
aiAdvice.title: Optimize Contact Bounce Mitigation Strategy

aiAdvice.description: Implement predictive SF6 pressure monitoring with automated alerts for gas quality degradation and leakage detection.
aiAdvice.title: Enhanced SF6 Gas Management Protocol

longTerm: Extended circuit breaker service life by 25-30%
Improved grid reliability and reduced downtime
riskMitigation: Prevent catastrophic failures through early detection
shortTerm: Immediate improvement in contact resistance stability

futureFaultsPdf.evidence: Correlated with slight pressure drops over the last 3 tests.
Based on minor, recurring deviations in the travel curve signature.
Common failure mode for this model after 10 years of service.

actions.justification: SF6 pressure declining from 7.0 to 6.8 bar over recent tests. Gas quality directly affects arc quenching and contact performance.
actions.title: Perform SF6 Gas Analysis and Pressure Check
whatToLookFor: Leak detection at joints and seals

actions.justification: Travel distance measurements show slight deviations from expected values during operation.
actions.title: Calibrate Travel Distance Sensors

actions.justification: Travel time variations suggest increased friction in the operating mechanism.
actions.title: Lubricate Operating Mechanism

aiVerdict.severityReason: Slight bounce detected which may accelerate contact wear.

phaseWiseAnalysis.description: Initial state before arc contact occurs

characteristics: Travel distance increasing as contacts approach
High resistance due to air gap
details.resistance: High resistance (~850 µΩ) - contacts are open
details.travel: Gradual increase from 200 to 500 - contact approaching

phaseWiseAnalysis.diagnosticVerdict: Healthy. This phase serves as a baseline for mechanical operation. A consistent travel curve confirms a healthy operating mechanism without hesitations or obstructions.
phaseWiseAnalysis.eventSynopsis: The 'Close' command initiates the operating mechanism, which moves the contact assembly towards the fixed contacts. During this phase, there is no electrical connection.
phaseWiseAnalysis.name: Pre-Contact Travel

waveformAnalysis.current: Remains at zero, confirming the absence of any conductive path or leakage.
waveformAnalysis.resistance: Remains at a state of infinite resistance, indicating a clean and sufficient air gap between all contacts.
waveformAnalysis.travel: The curve shows a smooth, continuous ramp, representing the unimpeded mechanical movement of the contacts at the specified closing velocity.

phaseWiseAnalysis.description: Arcing contact engagement and arc initiation

characteristics: High resistance variability due to arcing
details.current: Sharp rise to ~720 - current flow begins
details.travel: Continues to increase to ~750 - contacts closing

phaseWiseAnalysis.diagnosticVerdict: Healthy. A crisp, singular drop in resistance confirms precise contact timing and alignment. The characteristics of the resistance during this short interval provide insight into the condition of the arcing tips and their ability to handle the initial electrical stress.
phaseWiseAnalysis.eventSynopsis: The moving arcing contact makes its first connection with the fixed arcing contact. This is the critical moment where current begins to flow, and any closing arc (or 'pre-arc') is established and managed.
phaseWiseAnalysis.name: Arcing Contact Engagement & Arc Initiation
phaseWiseAnalysis.phaseTitle: Closing Operation — Arcing Contact Engagement & Arc Initiation

waveformAnalysis.current: Begins to flow the instant the arcing contacts engage, showing a sharp rise.
waveformAnalysis.resistance: Exhibits a sudden, sharp drop from infinity to a finite resistance value. This distinctive drop pinpoints the moment of arcing contact touch. The initial peak and subsequent turbulent signature in this brief period reflect the dynamic nature of arc establishment as the contacts close.
waveformAnalysis.travel: The travel curve continues its upward trajectory, as the main contacts have not yet engaged.

details.current: Gradual decline from 720 to 670 - stable flow
details.resistance: Stable low resistance (~300 µΩ) - good contact

phaseWiseAnalysis.diagnosticVerdict: Healthy. A low and non-fluctuating static resistance is the hallmark of clean, well-aligned main contacts under proper mechanical pressure. This is the most important indicator of the breaker's ability to carry its rated current without overheating.
phaseWiseAnalysis.eventSynopsis: Following the engagement of the arcing contacts, the main contacts close and firmly seat. This establishes the primary, low-resistance path for continuous current flow. The breaker is now in a stable, fully closed position.
phaseWiseAnalysis.name: Main Contact Conduction
phaseWiseAnalysis.phaseTitle: Fully Closed State — Main Contact Conduction

waveformAnalysis.current: Rises to its full, steady-state value, reflecting the establishment of a low-resistance path.
waveformAnalysis.resistance: The resistance value drops dramatically to a minimal, stable, and nearly flat line (typically in the micro-ohm range). This signifies the transition of current from the arcing contacts to the larger, more conductive main contacts.
waveformAnalysis.travel: The curve flattens out, indicating that the contact assembly has completed its travel and is now mechanically latched.

phaseWiseAnalysis.description: Main contact parting and arc elongation

details.current: Sharp drop from 670 to 230 - current flow stops
details.resistance: Rising from 300 to 850 µΩ - contacts separating
details.travel: Sharp drop from 750 to 200 - contacts opening

phaseWiseAnalysis.diagnosticVerdict: Healthy. This signature confirms the correct opening sequence (main contacts part before arcing contacts). The profile of the rising resistance curve during arcing is a direct measure of the interrupter's effectiveness at de-ionizing the arc path, which is crucial for successful fault interruption.
phaseWiseAnalysis.eventSynopsis: The 'Open' or 'Trip' command is issued. The main contacts separate first, commutating the entire current flow to the arcing contacts. Immediately after, the arcing contacts separate, drawing an electrical arc. This arc is then elongated and cooled by the interrupting medium (e.g., SF₆ gas blast).
phaseWiseAnalysis.name: Main Contact Parting & Arc Elongation
phaseWiseAnalysis.phaseTitle: Opening Operation — Main Contact Parting & Arc Elongation

waveformAnalysis.current: Continues to flow through the arc until the point of extinction.
waveformAnalysis.resistance: Shows a sharp initial step-up from the micro-ohm level as the main contacts part. It then begins a steep climb as the arcing contacts separate and the plasma arc channel is stretched, cooled, and its resistance increases.
waveformAnalysis.travel: Begins a smooth downward ramp as the mechanism withdraws the contacts.

characteristics: High resistance due to air gap
details.resistance: High resistance (~850 µΩ) - contacts fully open

phaseWiseAnalysis.diagnosticVerdict: Healthy. A clean and final transition to zero current and infinite resistance signifies a successful interruption. The breaker is now in a safe, isolated, and dielectrically secure state.
phaseWiseAnalysis.eventSynopsis: The arc is successfully extinguished at a natural current zero. The arcing contacts have separated sufficiently to establish a dielectric gap capable of withstanding the system's recovery voltage, ensuring the circuit remains open.
phaseWiseAnalysis.name: Final Open State

waveformAnalysis.current: Drops definitively to zero. The absence of any post-arc current confirms a successful quench and no restrikes.
waveformAnalysis.resistance: Returns to an infinite value, indicating a complete and final interruption of the conductive path.
waveformAnalysis.travel: The travel curve settles at the fully open position, confirming the full mechanical stroke has been completed.
